title: How people saw a solar eclipse

utterances.translation: That happened a long, long time ago.
People in old days used to say that the sun got bitten off.

transcript.default: hayimḥickʷi ʔin wikuk ʔuḥ mamaɬn̓i qʷaa ʔaḥ nism̓aʔi ʔaḥʔaa hupaɬʔi ʔaḥʔaa sun hiɬʔaƛ ʔaminkšiʔaƛquu.

transcription.default: hayimḥickʷi ʔin wikuk ʔuḥ mamaɬn̓i qʷaa ʔaḥ nism̓aʔi ʔaḥʔaa hupaɬʔi ʔaḥʔaa sun hiɬʔaƛ ʔaminkšiʔaƛquu

utterances.translation: They didn’t know that it is not like that for white men: the earth, the moon and the sun meet up there.
It appears as if the earth bit off the sun.
They were really scared when it became dark.

transcript.default: tupʕaqƛ qii ʔuušyuuya ḥaaʔiʔat, ḥaaʔiʔatʔiš watqšiƛ. watqšiʔatʔiš waaʔat

transcription.default: tupʕaqƛ qii ʔuušyuuya ḥaaʔiʔat ḥaaʔiʔatʔiš watqšiƛ watqšiʔatʔiš waaʔat

utterances.translation: It was dark for a long time, it sometimes got completely dark — or “completely swallowed” they said.

transcript.default: hupaɬ wik̓iitšiʔaƛquu tum̓aqstuƛ, haa (maʔas) n̓iƛaak c̓iiqaaʔaƛquuč quuʔas c̓iiqaa.

transcription.default: hupaɬ wik̓iitšiʔaƛquu tum̓aqstuƛ haa maʔas n̓iƛaak c̓iiqaaʔaƛquuč quuʔas c̓iiqaa

utterances.translation: When the whole sun disappeared, it got dark and people got uproarious and they would sing songs.
Some people prayed for food and well-being.

transcript.default: waa ʔuukš tiičmis qʷaaqḥʔaaḥii čačimḥi hiɬ ʔaḥkuu nism̓aʔi.

transcription.default: waa ʔuukš tiičmis qʷaaqḥʔaaḥii čačimḥi hiɬ ʔaḥkuu nism̓aʔi

utterances.translation: And they prayed for their life and order on this land.

transcript.default: hayimḥi quuʔas qʷaaʔapii ḥaaɬ tuum̓aqstuuɬ, tum̓aqstuƛ.

transcription.default: hayimḥi quuʔas qʷaaʔapii ḥaaɬ tuum̓aqstuuɬ tum̓aqstuƛ

utterances.translation: People don’t know how it became dark for a short period of time.

transcript.default: qiiḥsn̓aak ʔuušyuuya ʔuuʔiʔat hupaɬʔi qʷaʔuuc qʷaaƛaa hupaɬʔi ƛaʔuu, yaaqʷiɬ mamaɬn̓i sun waa.

transcription.default: qiiḥsn̓aak ʔuušyuuya ʔuuʔiʔat hupaɬʔi qʷaʔuuc qʷaaƛaa hupaɬʔi ƛaʔuu yaaqʷiɬ mamaɬn̓i sun waa

utterances.translation: Every once in a long while the sun takes away (hides) the moon — the moon is also called “the other sun”.
[People used to think that] Son of Cod-in-the-Sky swallows both the moon and the sun.

transcript.default: waa ʔuušckʷiiʔaɬ č̓apac ʔukʷiqsiƛ, hat̓iis, hat̓inʕaqa.

transcription.default: waa ʔuušckʷiiʔaɬ č̓apac ʔukʷiqsiƛ hat̓iis hat̓inʕaqa

utterances.translation: And some people got out on canoes and bathed themselves.
